# Scale: Harmonic in G (Mode: Locrian #6, Shape: E)

## Description:
The Harmonic scale in G, also known as the Locrian #6 mode, has a distinct sound due to its unique combination of intervals. It is based on a root note of G and follows a specific pattern of whole and half steps that gives it a characteristic flavor.

## Notes and Intervals:
The notes in the Harmonic scale in G (Locrian #6) are as follows:
- G (Root)
- Ab (Minor 2nd)
- Bb (Minor 3rd)
- C (Perfect 4th)
- Db (Diminished 5th)
- E (Locrian #6)
- F# (Major 7th)

The intervals in this scale create an exotic and mysterious sound, with the diminished 5th and Locrian #6 being especially distinctive.

## Genre and Musical Flavor:
The Harmonic scale in G (Locrian #6) is often used in Jazz, Fusion, and Progressive Metal genres. It gives a sense of tension and unease due to the dissonant intervals present in the scale. The mysterious and exotic flavor of this scale makes it an intriguing choice for musicians looking to create a unique and captivating sound.
